Install heated bus shelters, bus displays, bike racks, stop signs and concrete pads in the Cityof Barrie
result: Improved accessibility, capacity, quality and safety of existing and future transit system.

description: Purchase 21 specialized city buses to replace the retiring fleet.
result: Improved reliability, quality and safety of the transit system by replacing the aging fleet with new, up-to-date buses.

project_name: Allandale Mobility Hub and Downtown Connection Hub - Construction
description: The site will include bus platforms, lay by express bus stops, and a terminal building. The Downtown Connection Hub will function as the primary bus stop within the Downtown by providing lay by lanes and bus stops with a shelter to serve the Downtown with the relocation of the primary terminal to the site adjacent to the Allandale Waterfront GO Station.
result: Improved capacity of public transit infrastructure

project_name: Replacement of Computer Aided Dispatch (CAD) andAutomatic Vehicle Location (AVL) System.
description: This project consists of the design, build and installation of a new Computer Aided Dispatch/Automatic Vehicle Location (CAD/AVL) system, including all supporting devices, operating systems, networking gear, related application software and data radio network.
result: The project will result in improved quality and safety of the public transit system in Brampton, Ontario.

project_name: Vehicle hoist replacement and fuel pump expansion
description: The purchase of a new fuel pump with twinned dispensing nozzles and two vehicle hoists will improve the quality of the public transit system
result: The project will improve the quality of the public transit system

project_name: Enhanced Stop Amenities for Priority (Express) Bus Corridors
description: The project scope includes the procurement of services and installation of up to 89 large transit stop shelters that will be fully heated, include doors that meet provincial accessibility standard, and new digital signage. The shelters will be installed within four Frequent Rapid Transit Network Bus Priority Corridor.
result: The project will result in improved capacity, quality, safety and improved access to the public transit system in Mississauga, Ontario

description: This project will involve the installation of 210 new bus shelters at existing bus stops. Shelter types include solar powered lighting, hydro powered lighting and ad panel lighting.
result: Increased quality and safety within on-street transit shelters due to enhanced lighting and visibility of customers awaiting pick-up.

description: This project consists of the installation of one shelter at each of four (4) bus terminals. The project will deliver heated shelters with digitized signage at the Laird/Vega Bus Loop, Meadowvale Town Centre, Erin Mills Town Centre and Dixie Outlet Mall.
result: The project will result in increased quality of, and access to, the transit system in Mississauga, Ontario.

project_name: New and/or Rehabilitation of Bus Stop Pads
description: The project involves the installation of new bus stop pads and rehabilitation of existing ones to ensure that bus stops are fully accessible.
result: The project will lead to improved quality and accessibility of the public transit system in the City of Mississauga, Ontario.

project_name: Replacement of Stop Markers with New Accessible Design
description: Purchase and installation of 3325 bus poles and 6650 stop markers. Stop markers will be printed accordingto a new accessible design to be implemented system wide (at all bus stops).
result: The project will result in improved quality and safety of the transit system and improved access to a public transit system in Mississauga, Ontario.

description: The project scope includes construction of enhanced glass partitions on top of an existing median concrete jersey barriers that separate the buses travelling in different directions at seven stations along the Mississauga Transitway. The seven stations are located at Central Parkway Station, Cawthra Station, Tomken Station, Dixie Station, Tahoe Station, Etobicoke Creek Station, and Spectrum Station.
result: The project will result in improved safety of public transit system infrastructure in the City of Mississauga, Ontario.

description: The project scope includes various transit assets including two new accessible passenger pick-up layby’s, public facing signage to provide customer safety information at 17 locations and additional pylon signage at City Centre Transit Terminal (CCTT) and Westwood stations.
result: The project will result in improved quality, and safety of existing and future public transit system infrastructure as well as improved access to the public transit system in the City of Mississauga, Ontario.

project_name: Transit Priority Measures (Infrastructure) for Priority (Express) Bus Corridors
description: The Project involves implementation of transit priority measures to improve and enhance three Mississauga bus corridors identified within the City Right of Way (ROW). The project will construct queue jump lanes at 25 intersections on both approaches (i.e., 2 at each intersection) for a total of 16 on Derry Rd., 16 on Eglinton Rd., and 18 on Dixie Rd. Total length of assets is ~0.6km (~12m per queue jump lane).
result: Improve quality and safety of the existing transit system with safety related and operational improvements

project_name: Brampton (A. Grenville and William Davis) Courthouse Addition - Phase 2
description: Fit-out of the top four floors of the building addition, as well as renovations to the Land Registry Office. This project is being  delivered  with the Toronto Region Bail Centre as a P3 bundle, and the project budget of $82.3M includes both projects.
result: Increased number of courtrooms and associated administrative spaces, as well as additional judicial parking spaces.
Improved justice services to Torontonians in state-of-the-art facility

description: Renovation of existing courthouse at 2201 Finch Ave. W.  This project is being  delivered  with the Brampton Courthouse Addition Phase 2 as a P3 bundle, and the project budget of $82.3M includes both projects.
result: Accommodation of the bail program associated with the new Toronto courthouse.

description: New construction of a children's treatment centre in Ajax.
result: The new centre will create more treatment spaces, shorter wait times and a modern facility so that families can access the care they need sooner.

result: Construction of a 5,775 sq. ft. suite and a 2,200 sq. ft. section 23 classroom

description: A new light rail transit (LRT) system along Eglinton Avenue to improve connectivity in Toronto.
result: Improved transit across Toronto's East & West ends.

description: A new subway line that will provide faster and more reliable transit in Toronto.
result: Increase public transport accessibility and reduce congestion.

description: Rehabilitation of key bridge segments along the DVP to improve traffic safety and structural integrity.
result: Reduced traffic delays and improved bridge lifespan.

description: New community centre including gym, pool, and classrooms for local residents.
result: Enhanced access to local recreational and social spaces.

description: Ongoing structural maintenance to extend the Gardiner’s lifespan and ensure public safety.
result: Improved structural stability and reduced future maintenance.

result: Better accessibility and improved street safety.

description: Replacement of aging watermain infrastructure to improve water service reliability.
result: Better water service and road durability.

description: Expanding and modernizing King Street's dedicated streetcar corridor.
result: Improved commute times and reduced congestion on King Street.

description: Reinforcement and seismic upgrade to the Bloor Street Viaduct.
result: Increased structural resilience and reduced risk of failure.

description: Energy-efficient upgrades and accessibility improvements to the center.
result: Improved accessibility and services for residents of East York.
